mods.abstract: $300 Reward. RANAWAY from the subscriber, the negro man TOM ANDERSON--about 40 years of age, five feet eight or ten inches high, stout make, dark mulatto, wears full beard and moustache, and lost one of his upper side teeth; has a very bad scar on the inside of one knee, caused by a cut from a foot-adze; in conversation, speaks very indistinctly, his pronunciation being that of a Virginia or Carolina negro. He is a carpenter, and can read and wirte, though not very well. Also, negro man JACKSON--about 45 years old, six feet high, black complection, wear beard and moustache, speaks quick, but indistinctly, having the same peculiar pronounciation as Tom Anderson. He is also a carpenter. I will pay the above reward for both of them, or 150 dollars for either, if taken out of the State. If taken in the State, 200 dollars for both, or 100 dollars for either of them, delivered at my plantation in West Baton Rouge, five miles below Port Hudson, or lodged in jail in the town of St. Francisville. ROB'T H. BARROW. Bayou Sara, La., Dec. 23, 1854. d23-3t
